attributes.action: keep McJob in the dictionary, prevent the English language being corrupted by McDonald's and oppose the Commons motion tabled by Clive Betts MP in support of the restaurant chain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: McDonald's has begun a campaign to have the word McJob removed from the Oxford English Dictionary. The OED defines a McJob as an "unstimulating, low-paid job with few prospects". While this may be derogatory to any workers at McDonald's, it is not up to a corporation to decide what is or isn't in the dictionary. The dictionary is a reflection of the language used by english speakers, not a marketing tool for big business.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
